name: Cordelia
message: It's freezing, I feel like I'm gonna die from the cold！

name: Jonathan
message: I wonder if this mantelpiece will actually light up properly？

name: Cordelia
message: The firewood's in already.
It　looks　like　it　was　left　alone　for　a　long　time,　so　it　might　be　damp　though.

name: Thomas
message: Just try putting it on, okay?
You　always　overthink　things　before　doing　anything.
Just give it a shot first, and if it doesn't work out, worry about it then.

name: Jonathan
message: If you take hedonism that far, it's kinda impressive.
So if things are good in the moment, you just don't care about anything else?

name: Cordelia
message: We've already checked this place out thoroughly, haven't we?
Isn't there nothing there？

name: Jonathan
message: Is that so?
I feel like something might be hidden here...

name: Jonathan
message: There's nowhere else Dollie would probably leave the key to the study, though.
This is the president's office where Dollie Dunwich became the last master of the final room.
Is the Necronomicon hidden somewhere in this room？
Inside the room, a few personal things and books that were probably used by Dollie for work are left behind.
I don't see anything that looks like it though......
If it had been left somewhere obvious, it's not weird to think I would've already found it by now.
I should probably assume it's hidden somewhere out of sight.
Where the hell is it...
It's all neatly organized.
Dollie seemed to have a really meticulous personality.
A thin layer of dust has piled up on the floor, making it obvious that nobody has set foot in this room for a long time.
The faded wallpaper and the completely withered potted plants tell how many years have passed since the owner of this room left.
Dorothy never let anyone into the president's office, but she probably had only been in this room a handful of times herself.
It's probably the Miskatonic University school flag.
It's fixed firmly to the wall, but it's completely faded from sunlight.
To think that this room and even the national flag on the wall were only actually used for less than a hundred short years...
It's probably the Miskatonic University school flag.
It looks like it was actually used for a really short time, so there's not much damage, but the sunlight exposure and bug holes are pretty bad.

name: Jonathan
message: Does anyone have a match and some paper that looks like it could be used for kindling？　　　　　　　　Let's try and see if we can get a fire going.

name: Thomas
message: Here, use this.
I started wrestling with the old mantelpiece, using the box of matches I got from Thomas and a scrap of paper torn from my notebook.

name: Cordelia
message: It's okay, Jonathan.
You've never used such an old heater like this, have you？

name: Jonathan
message: No, in the house where I was born, every room had this kind of old-fashioned mantelpiece.

name: Jonathan
message: With this......

name: Jonathan
message: Alright, got the fire going.

name: Thomas
message: It's getting warmer.
Let's take a break for a while, shall we?

name: Jonathan
message: The wallpaper's started peeling off.

name: Gardner
message: It was in a freezing room all this time, and then suddenly got warmed up-that's probably it. Dorothy would freak if she saw.

name: Jonathan
message: Could it really come off this easily?
It's like after peeling it off once, it got glued back on again...

name: Cordelia
message: No way, under the wallpaper！

name: Jonathan
message: Let's give it a try.

name: Cordelia
message: This is.........

name: Cordelia
message: Is this the Necronomicon？

name: Jonathan
message: No doubt about it, this is the same book I saw in my dream.
But I never thought it would be in a place like this.

name: Gardner
message: Don't get so worked up.
It's just a coincidence, that's gotta be it......

name: Thomas
message: Just hurry up and check inside already！
What's written there？

name: Jonathan
message: Wait, don't rush me like that.

name: Jonathan
message: So this is the Necronomicon......

name: Jonathan
message: I have no idea what this says.
This is...
There's a key stuck between the pages of the book.
Maybe it's the key to Dollie's study in the Dunwitch Mansion.
So that means Dollie was the one who hid the Necronomicon in the principal's office？
Why did Dollie have the Necronomicon?
The design is clearly different from the other room keys for the Dunwich Mansion that I got from Marsh.
It's like it's emphasizing that this is a special key......
The key that Dollie told Marsh to throw away once he was done with it must've been a hastily made spare.
The master key, I hid it in my dorm room at the university along with the book ahead of time, before causing the incident.
I put the key that was tucked inside the Necronomicon into my coat pocket.
Because I felt that this key should never be given to anyone else.

name: Jonathan
message: Now we can escape the village.
Let's go, I don't want to be in a place like this for even a second.

name: Thomas
message: That's not gonna happen.

name: Cordelia
message: Ouch...! W-what are you doing?

name: Jonathan
message: Cordelia？

name: Jonathan
message: Thomas！

name: Thomas
message: You're an idiot.
You’ve always thought I was suspicious, haven’t you？

name: Thomas
message: And yet, we're still together all this time.
I should've just killed them quick when I first thought this was bad.

name: Jonathan
message: What are you trying to pull? Let go of her hand.
What are you planning to do with Cordelia?

name: Thomas
message: No way, I can't let that happen.

name: Jonathan
message: What do you want?

name: Thomas
message: Hand over that book.
If you don't hurry up, I'll kill the girl.
Thomas is pressing a gun against Cordelia's temple, his hand wrapped around her neck.
There's nothing I can do about this.

name: Thomas
message: Don't get any weird ideas, the woman will die.

name: Jonathan
message: Why do you want the Necronomicon?
Are you planning to escape the village all by yourself?

name: Thomas
message: That's the 'Lost key'.
Oh, and let me tell you one thing...

name: Thomas
message: The monster you guys saw is called a 'Deep One'.
That guy's just a small fry.

name: Jonathan
message: Are you saying there are more guys like that?

name: Thomas
message: Those guys, you know, they're nothing but food for the god Dagon that they're about to summon using this book.

name: Jonathan
message: Dagon's god？

name: Thomas
message: Yeah, it's some god called 'Cthulhu'.
I've never seen it either, though.

name: Jonathan
message: So that's the god Dagon worships...

name: Thomas
message: Apparently, it’s got enough power to turn the whole world upside down.
If you use that book, the Necronomicon, it means you can summon that thing.

name: Gardner
message: Ridiculous.
Have you guys lost your minds？

name: Gardner
message: Are you really swallowing such fairy tales？ Wake up already！

name: Thomas
message: Looks like the old man still doesn't really get the situation.
Not just Nai and Dagon’s guys, but even my Secret society were desperately hunting for that book, for decades, you know.

name: Jonathan
message: If everything I saw in my dreams also happened for the Necronomicon and Dagon’s god...

name: Thomas
message: So, for a hell of a long time, all sorts of people have been putting on an act, huh.
For the sake of the old man's fairy tale.

name: Gardner
message: How can you believe something like that！

name: Thomas
message: I don't give a damn if you believe me or not. Jonathan, hand over that book.

name: Thomas
message: Don't try anything funny.
Give that book to the woman！

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan............
Can't be helped.
At this rate, Cordelia's life...

name: Jonathan
message: Cordelia, take this.

name: Jonathan
message: This should satisfy you.

name: Jonathan
message: Let go of Cordelia.

name: Thomas
message: No way that's happening.
This woman will be the sacrifice after summoning Cthulhu.

name: Jonathan
message: You broke your promise！

name: Thomas
message: You're as soft as ever. Still can't figure out what kind of guy I am？

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan...help me...

name: Thomas
message: Nobody's gonna help me.
You were picked up just for this, you know.

name: Thomas
message: Don’t you ever feel like you want to pay back your parents who raised you, or even the villagers, even a little？

name: Jonathan
message: Let go of Cordelia！

name: Thomas
message: I told you no, didn't I?
Don't move, or should I kill the woman right here？

name: Thomas
message: See ya, Jonathan.

name: Thomas
message: Do your best, that's all you can do.
Maybe we'll be able to get out of the village alive.

name: Jonathan
message: What a filthy bastard......

name: Thomas
message: See ya.
Thomas took Cordelia and disappeared beyond the door.
I can't believe this is happening...
If I’d known it would turn out like this, I wouldn’t have brought that guy along. There’s no way I’ll let them use Cordelia as a sacrifice.

name: Jonathan
message: Shit.

name: Gardner
message: Wait, where are you going.

name: Jonathan
message: Of course I'm gonna chase after him！
There’s no sign of the two of them in the Archives hallway anymore.
My and Gardner's footsteps echo off the walls and sound ridiculously loud.

name: Gardner
message: He's already gone?
What a fast guy.

name: Jonathan
message: That is...

name: Jonathan
message: That's the gun Thomas had.
In the middle of the hallway, the gun that Thomas was holding until just a moment ago is lying on the floor.
He probably had no choice but to let go of it-holding Cordelia down with one hand and grabbing the Necronomicon with the other.
I picked up the gun and pulled out the magazine.

name: Jonathan
message: The magazine's empty.
There　weren't　any　bullets　in　there　from　the　start.....

name: Gardner
message: What the hell.
So that guy totally got one over on us, huh.

name: Jonathan
message: Dammit... What are you planning to do with Cordelia！

name: Gardner
message: Wait, Jonathan！

name: Gardner
message: Don't get all fired up.
That guy's lost his mind. If you go after him carelessly, that girl's life's in danger.

name: Jonathan
message: No way！
I'll chase after them right away

name: Gardner
message: I told you, that's just going to backfire.

name: Jonathan
message: There's no way I'm letting Cordelia be a sacrifice...

name: Jonathan
message: I'm gonna find Thomas and kill him！

name: Gardner
message: Can't be helped......

name: Gardner
message: Hang in there for a bit.

name: Thomas
message: In mystery novels, sometimes there's a letter in the chimney that tells who the culprit is, you know.
The Necronomicon isn’t as small as a letter in an envelope.
It's a different story if the person who hid the book was absolutely sure that a fire would never be lit in the mantelpiece...
If that wasn't the case, there's no way they'd hide it in a place like this.
If a fire were lit, the book would burn easily.

name: Thomas
message: Jonathan, how about sticking your hand inside the chimney？
There might be a book here, you know.

name: Jonathan
message: Are you making fun of me？
If there were books stored in a place like this, even if you burned a fire, the smoke wouldn't get out, and the whole room would just fill up with smoke.
I can't imagine the book is actually in here.
It's not clear exactly when the Necronomicon stopped being seen by people, but back when Dollie was alive, the room was used often.
Of course, there should've been a fire burning in the fireplace-if that happened, those precious books would've gone up in smoke.

name: Thomas
message: How long are you gonna keep staring at that?
It's not really cold or anything.

name: Jonathan
message: There’s still firewood in the fireplace, so I was wondering if this fireplace actually still works.

name: Thomas
message: Even if it does work, we don’t need it now.
It’s　actually　pretty　warm　in　this　room.
Just like the room’s simple construction, the mantelpiece is all about utility, with barely any decorative flair.
Inside, there’s ash from decades ago and some partially burned wood left just as it was.
I can almost picture Dollie carefully using the poker.
On Dollie’s neatly arranged desk-without even the slightest mess-dust has piled up, making it obvious nobody’s touched it in ages.
All the stacked books are typical academics you’d find anywhere, nothing unusual or out of place.
Apparently, Dollie didn’t like bringing personal stuff into the workspace. Or maybe anything of value has already been taken by someone else.
Looks like there’s not much more to be gained here.
Maybe somewhere else…
There used to be a map of Arkham hanging here.
Why did Dollie put something like that up on the wall, I wonder.
He must have known the geography of the little village where he was born well enough without needing to look at a map at this point.
It’s like he predicted that after he died, we would come to this room.
I already have such a clear memory of Arkham’s layout that I can picture it anytime in my mind.
I wonder if you can get attached to a place like this, too.
Reception
